page.title: 15DEE ESTUARY, NESTON
page.content: Situated along the Dee Estuary are the marshes, once a sandy bay.In 1928 people planted Spartina Grass to bind the sand together. It spread rapidly along the shore.Now it is just marshy ground used for swimming, walking, birdwatching, fishing and many other activities.Children sometimes take their remote control boats to sail in the gullies.Every winter 154,000 birds come to the marshes.Here is a selection - Red Shank, Tern, Shell Duck, Heron, Black Headed Gull, Oyster Catcher and Reed Bunting.People go fishing down on the marshes and they sometimes catch crabs and eels.Each Spring and Autumn we have a high tide. There are a few people living in bungalows along the estuary and they have to have sandbags ready in case of a high tide.
